head.title: Be Thou My Vision
head.wordsAuthor: Old Irish hymn, trans. Mary E. Byrne

lg.l: Be thou my `vi-sion, O Lord of my heart;
naught be all else to me, save that thou art.
Thou my best thought, _ by day or by night,
Be thou my wisdom, be thou my true word;
I `e-ver with thee, and thou with me, Lord.
Born of thy love, _ thy child may I be,
thou in me `dwel-ling and I one with thee.
High King of `hea-ven, when `vic-t’ry is won
may I reach `heav-en’s joys, O bright heav’n’s Sun!
Heart of my heart, _ what-`e-ver be-`fall,
still be my `vi-sion, O `Ru-ler of all.
